org.knime.core.node.port.database.writer

Interface DBWriter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBWriterImpl

    public interface DBWriter
    Since:
    3.1
    Author:
    Tobias Koetter, KNIME.com

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String deleteRows(String schema, String table, BufferedDataTable data, String[] whereColumns, int[] deleteStatus, ExecutionMonitor exec, CredentialsProvider cp, int batchSize)
      Delete rows from the given database table.
      String updateTable(String schema, String table, BufferedDataTable data, String[] setColumns, String[] whereColumns, int[] updateStatus, ExecutionMonitor exec, CredentialsProvider cp, int batchSize)
      Update rows in the given database table.
      String writeData(String table, RowInput input, long rowCount, boolean appendData, ExecutionMonitor exec, Map<String,String> sqlTypes, CredentialsProvider cp, int batchSize, boolean insertNullForMissingCols)
      Deprecated. 
      use writeData(String, String, RowInput, long, ExecutionMonitor, CredentialsProvider, int) instead
      default String writeData(String schema, String table, RowInput data, long rowCount, ExecutionMonitor exec, CredentialsProvider cp, int batchSize)
      Create connection to write into database.

    • Method Detail

      • writeData

        default String writeData(String schema,
                         String table,
                         RowInput data,
                         long rowCount,
                         ExecutionMonitor exec,
                         CredentialsProvider cp,
                         int batchSize)
                  throws Exception
        Create connection to write into database. Assumes that the table exists and only appends data to the existing table.
        Parameters:
        schema - optional db schema
        table - name of table to write
        data - The data to write.
        rowCount - number of row of the table to write, -1 if unknown
        exec - Used the cancel writing.
        sqlTypes - A mapping from column name to SQL-type.
        cp - CredentialsProvider providing user/password
        batchSize - number of rows written in one batch
        Returns:
        error string or null, if non
        Throws:
        Exception - if connection could not be established

      • writeData

        @Deprecated
String writeData(String table,
                             RowInput input,
                             long rowCount,
                             boolean appendData,
                             ExecutionMonitor exec,
                             Map<String,String> sqlTypes,
                             CredentialsProvider cp,
                             int batchSize,
                             boolean insertNullForMissingCols)
                      throws Exception
        Deprecated. use writeData(String, String, RowInput, long, ExecutionMonitor, CredentialsProvider, int) instead
        Create connection to write into database.
        Parameters:
        schema - table schema name. Could be null.
        table - name of table to write
        input - the data table as as row input
        rowCount - number of row of the table to write, -1 if unknown
        appendData - if checked the data is appended to an existing table
        exec - Used the cancel writing.
        sqlTypes - A mapping from column name to SQL-type.
        cp - CredentialsProvider providing user/password
        batchSize - number of rows written in one batch
        insertNullForMissingCols - true if null should be inserted for missing columns
        Returns:
        error string or null, if non
        Throws:
        Exception - if connection could not be established

      • updateTable

        String updateTable(String schema,
                   String table,
                   BufferedDataTable data,
                   String[] setColumns,
                   String[] whereColumns,
                   int[] updateStatus,
                   ExecutionMonitor exec,
                   CredentialsProvider cp,
                   int batchSize)
            throws Exception
        Update rows in the given database table.
        Parameters:
        schema - optional db schema
        table - name of table to write
        data - The data to write.
        setColumns - columns part of the SET clause
        whereColumns - columns part of the WHERE clause
        updateStatus - int array of length data#getRowCount; will be filled with update info from the database
        exec - Used the cancel writing.
        cp - CredentialsProvider providing user/password
        batchSize - number of rows updated in one batch
        Returns:
        error string or null, if non
        Throws:
        Exception - if connection could not be established

      • deleteRows

        String deleteRows(String schema,
                  String table,
                  BufferedDataTable data,
                  String[] whereColumns,
                  int[] deleteStatus,
                  ExecutionMonitor exec,
                  CredentialsProvider cp,
                  int batchSize)
           throws Exception
        Delete rows from the given database table.
        Parameters:
        schema - optional db schema
        table - name of table to write
        data - The data to write.
        whereColumns - columns part of the WHERE clause
        deleteStatus - int array of length data#getRowCount; will be filled with the number of rows effected
        exec - Used the cancel writing.
        cp - CredentialsProvider providing user/password
        batchSize - number of rows deleted in one batch
        Returns:
        error string or null, if non
        Throws:
        Exception - if connection could not be established
